overview: From 2025-08-31 to 2025-09-07, ethereum-optimism/ecosystem had 1 new PRs (1 merged), 10 new issues, and 45 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Update font on app.optimism.io
topIssues.author: jvmi7
topIssues.body: Update the typeface using the brand font (Riforma) on https://app.optimism.io/bridge/deposit

topIssues.title: Update font on docs.optimism.io
topIssues.author: jvmi7
topIssues.body: Update font to new brand kit font

topIssues.title: Implement storybook + design system for optimism.io
topIssues.author: jvmi7

topIssues.title: Add atlas to localchain.dev & update logo to be clicky
topIssues.author: jvmi7

topPRs.title: Remove Verbs
topPRs.author: its-everdred
topPRs.body:
## Problem

We moved [verbs](https://verbs.money) out into its own [repo](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/verbs)

## Solution

Remove the old packages from here

topContributors.summary: smartcontracts: Made significant progress on un-merged work this week, committing a large volume of changes (+4676/-1739 lines) across 167 files. This effort was primarily directed at bug fixes (68%) and feature development (32%). They also supported the team by providing feedback across 4 pull requests.

geoknee: Advanced the 'min-base-fee' feature by opening a pull request to bring in op-geth code (ethereum-optimism/optimism#17307) and updating the associated design document (ethereum-optimism/design-docs#333). They were also highly engaged in collaboration, providing 12 reviews and numerous comments across repositories. Their development work, spread across 14 commits, focused on a mix of bug fixes and other feature work.

Wazabie: Focused on upgrading Superchain testnet infrastructure, opening three pull requests in ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops to advance the Zora, Metal, and Mode Sepolia environments (#1180, #1181, #1182). This work in progress modified 37 files, adding over 600 lines of changes. The contributions primarily involved documentation and operational configurations.

blmalone focused on enhancing CI performance and stability in the `ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops` repository this week. They merged several impactful pull requests, notably improving CI performance by 40% by skipping account access decoding (#1178) and reducing common CI failures by limiting concurrent processes (#1177). This work, primarily categorized as bug fixes, involved modifications to documentation and configuration files to ensure a more reliable development pipeline.

maurelian: Focused on collaboration and project maintenance, providing significant support through 11 code reviews this week. They merged a CI configuration cleanup in ethereum-optimism/superchain-registry#1101 and have an open pull request to update contract addresses. Their contributions centered on maintaining the project's configuration files.

pcw109550: Focused on improving testing infrastructure, merging a pull request in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#17299) to add sync namespace support to the `op-sync-tester`. They also created new issues to track additional test enhancements and address flakiness (#17313, #17298), and provided 3 code reviews. All of their code contributions were concentrated on improving tests through new development and refactoring.

scharissis: Focused on improving infrastructure and testing, merging a significant refactor to improve test logging (ethereum-optimism/infra#453) and introducing `mise` for tool version management (ethereum-optimism/infra#452). They also advanced acceptance test capabilities by creating and closing two related issues (ethereum-optimism/infra#398, ethereum-optimism/optimism#16272) and providing 7 code reviews. This work demonstrates a primary focus on bug fixes, feature implementation, and refactoring across the codebase.

serpixel focused on enhancing testing infrastructure by porting acceptance tests within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They merged a significant refactor (PR #17300, +91/-494 lines) to port smoke and system negotiation tests, which they tracked via two issues they also created and closed. This work, along with two code reviews, demonstrates a clear focus on improving test reliability through a mix of feature and bugfix efforts.

JosepBove: Focused on a significant update to the `ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops` repository, opening a large pull request (#1179) to enable and disable LivenessModule2 templates. This work involved substantial changes across 130 files (+3625/-1560 lines) and was supplemented by collaborative engagement through 6 code reviews. The code modifications indicate a primary focus on expanding test coverage for this functionality.

ccerv1: Advanced the `ethereum-optimism/Retro-Funding` project by landing foundational work and a key bugfix. They introduced significant scaffolding for S8 rewards calculations via PR #74. They also resolved an issue with missing monthly summary metrics in PR #75, demonstrating a focus on both feature development and bug fixes.

chuxinh: This week, chuxinh's efforts were centered on expanding data analysis capabilities for the `ethereum-optimism/op-analytics` repository. They landed a massive pull request (#1740) to add new chain analysis output, introducing a significant change of over 44,000 lines of code. This singular, impactful contribution demonstrates a clear focus on enhancing the project's analytics tooling.
mds1: Supported the team through code review this week, providing 3 approvals on pull requests.

nonsense: Focused on improving CI test infrastructure, opening a pull request in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#17314) to enable nightly sync tests with changes spanning 62 files (+1183/-333 lines). They also supported the team by providing 8 code reviews. Their work this week was primarily focused on tests and configuration files.

AmadiMichael concentrated on bugfix work this week, pushing two commits with over 100 lines of changes. They also supported the team's progress by providing two code reviews. All of their coding contributions were focused on bugfixes.

sebastianst: Focused on supporting team progress through active code review while preparing a significant body of work. They conducted 9 reviews for their peers and pushed a substantial set of commits modifying 191 files (+9949/-1823 lines).

wlawt: Made substantial progress on a large-scale change for the minimum base fee, captured in the open pull request ethereum-optimism/optimism#17315. This significant effort involved 104 commits modifying 583 files (+18532/-12114 lines). The work was a mix of new development and bug fixes, with a healthy balance of code and associated test files.

stevennevins: Pushed a significant volume of code changes (+5060/-583 lines across 35 commits) this week, with a primary focus on bugfixes and tests. In addition to this development effort, they supported the team by reviewing two pull requests.

its-everdred: Focused on a significant code cleanup within the `ethereum-optimism/ecosystem` repository this week. This work culminated in merging PR #946, a large refactor that removed over 1,800 lines of code. The changes touched a mix of code and configuration files, streamlining the project's codebase.
Inphi: Supported the team by providing code reviews, approving 2 pull requests.

bitwiseguy: Focused on improving the developer build process by opening a pull request to streamline the build recipe in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#17304). In addition to this work, they also supported the team by providing a review approval and commenting on an issue.

hexshire: This week's activity primarily consisted of 7 commits with substantial code changes (+3368/-303 lines across 37 files), though no pull requests were opened or merged. They also contributed one comment during a pull request review.

ajsutton: Focused on CI improvements and team collaboration this week, merging a configuration change in ethereum-optimism/optimism#17296. They were also highly engaged in providing feedback, contributing 3 reviews and numerous comments across 7 different issues and other pull requests. This activity indicates a primary focus on infrastructure and configuration.

zhiqiangxu: Focused on improving the testing infrastructure, undertaking a significant effort that modified 719 test files with over 28,000 lines of code added. They opened a pull request in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` to improve error handling for the sync tester (#17312). This work consisted of bug fixes and other general improvements entirely within the project's test suite.
joshklop: No activity this week.
alcueca: No activity this week.
wiz-inc-a178a98b5d: No activity this week.
almanax-ai: No activity this week.

jvmi7 focused on project planning and task definition within the ethereum-optimism/ecosystem, creating 16 issues to scope out a major migration of the Optimism marketing site to React (#937). They broke down this large initiative into foundational tasks, including setting up a monorepo (#938), creating a shared UI package (#942), and bootstrapping the Next.js application (#939). Additionally, they created and closed seven smaller issues to address immediate UI and security needs, such as updating fonts and adding a Content Security Policy across several ecosystem sites (#934, #933, #923).

pauldowman: Focused on project planning and design, creating 9 issues to scope out new initiatives and track release readiness. Key contributions included authoring a first-pass design for the Aggregate Dispute Game (#17305) and establishing checklists to ensure passing tests for the Jovian release (#17302, #17303).

wood-jp: Focused on bug fixing within the `op-node` component, identifying an issue where p2p gossip parameters were overwriting defaults (ethereum-optimism/optimism#17308). They subsequently opened a pull request to fix the gossip parameter parsing (ethereum-optimism/optimism#17309), which included changes to both code and tests.

fainashalts: Focused on project improvement and collaboration this week, proposing to use the Superchain Registry for the token list in issue #1122. They also supported development progress by reviewing and approving 3 pull requests.
ericbrown99: Contributed to team progress this week by reviewing and approving 3 pull requests.

leopoldjoy: Focused on bug fixes this week, committing a substantial change set (+1447/-70 lines across 18 files). In addition to this development work, they also participated in the review process by providing comments on 3 pull requests.
zhwrd: Supported the team by providing 2 pull request approvals this week.
Ethnical: No activity this week.
hawkadrian: Focused on addressing a test-related issue, opening a pull request (ethereum-optimism/optimism#17311) to prevent a test failure. This work was concentrated entirely within the test suite.
blockchaindevsh: No activity this week.
0xiamflux: No activity this week.
pabloflixxo: Contributed to the Base ecosystem by opening a pull request to add the FLIXX token (ethereum-optimism/ethereum-optimism.github.io#1195). This work involved a small configuration change.

oooLowNeoNooo: This week, oooLowNeoNooo focused on improving the MIPS EVM component. They opened a pull request in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#17295) to add bounds checking and validation. This work reflects a focus on code correctness within the MIPS EVM.

MozirDmitriy: Focused on improving test correctness this week, opening a pull request (ethereum-optimism/optimism#17301) to address a storage-to-hash alignment issue. This contribution was concentrated on bugfixes within the project's acceptance tests.

drewroberts: Contributed to documentation quality by opening a pull request to remove a dead link in the ethereum-optimism/docs repository (PR #1732). This change involved a minor update to a configuration file.
tarunkhasnavis: Contributed to the team's progress by reviewing and approving one pull request.
mslipper: No activity this week.
janjakubnanista: Supported development this week by providing a code review and approval.
tynes: No activity this week.

JBTestingOP: This week's activity was focused on documentation, where they opened a pull request (ethereum-optimism/design-docs#332) to propose a minor change to a README file. This work consisted of a single commit modifying one documentation file (+1/-1 lines).
niran: Made progress on unsubmitted work, committing changes across 39 files (+359/-268). This work consisted of bug fixes and other general tasks.
agusduha: No activity this week.

opgitgovernance: Focused on project governance and tracking this week, creating two issues in the `ethereum-optimism/docs` repository to track monthly metrics reports (#1730, #1731). They also participated in ongoing work by leaving 6 comments on pull requests.

rebrax0: This week, rebrax0 focused on identifying potential issues within the `op-geth` client. They reported a potential bug concerning missing events on `eth_getLogs` calls in `ethereum-optimism/op-geth#667`.

cliff0412: This week, cliff0412 focused on identifying a potential bug in the `ethereum-optimism/op-geth` repository, opening an issue (#668) to report a panic in the level db when initializing with a large genesis file.
rodri-forta: Contributed one commit with minor code additions (+34 lines) and provided feedback on a pull request.

arisarcmarket: Made progress on development with 4 commits across 5 files (+48/-6 lines), with a primary focus on bugfix work. They also contributed to collaboration by providing 2 comments on pull requests.
